medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain associated with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain began at 0200, initially epigastric then moved to the right upper quadrant (RUQ) with radiation to the back. The pain was associated with nausea, vomiting three times of yellow liquid without blood, and chills. The patient also experienced mild chest pain similar to heartburn symptoms. Denies fevers, sweats, and shortness of breath.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Recurrent symptomatic cholelithiasis; personal history of allergy to penicillin; history of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD); lower back pain; prior surgical history includes bilateral tubal ligation and one cesarean section.
